threats.name: Threat of automatic malicious code propagation in grid systems
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of deploying and executing malicious code on behalf of a trusted process on any of the grid system's resource centers and its automatic propagation to all nodes of the grid system.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in grid computing technology - a high level of automation with minimal administrability of the grid system.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses the privileges of a legitimate grid system user
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of data aggregation transmitted in grid systems
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary disclosing protected information by identifying nodes involved in its processing, collecting, analyzing, and aggregating data intercepted in the grid system's data transmission network.
This threat is caused by a weakness in grid computing technology - the use of unprotected Internet channels as the grid system's transport network.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has:
forces and means sufficient to compensate for the extreme distribution of grid tasks among grid system nodes;
privileges sufficient to intercept data network traffic between elements (nodes) of the grid system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of cryptographic algorithm analysis and their implementation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of identifying weaknesses in cryptographic algorithms or vulnerabilities in the software implementing them.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in cryptographic algorithms, as well as errors in the program code of cryptographic tools, their integration with the system, or their configuration parameters.
Realization of the threat is possible if the adversary has information about the encryption tools used in the system, the encryption algorithms implemented in them, and their configuration parameters
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of hardware BIOS password reset
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of resetting passwords set in BIOS/UEFI without going through the system authorization procedure by de-energizing the BIOS chip (removing the battery) or setting a jumper in the standard location on the motherboard (switching the "jumper").
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in some system (mother) boards - the presence of hardware mechanisms for resetting passwords set in BIOS/UEFI.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has physical access to the computer's system unit
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of malicious code injection into BIOS
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of forcing BIOS/UEFI to execute malicious code at every computer startup by injecting it into BIOS/UEFI through replacement of the BIOS/UEFI chip or updating the BIOS/UEFI software to a version that already contains malicious code.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in technologies for controlling BIOS/UEFI software updates and BIOS/UEFI chipset replacement.
Realization of this threat is possible during computer repair and maintenance
violator: Internal threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of code or data injection
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of exploiting privileged programs
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of authentication information recovery and/or reuse
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of accessing user data through guessing (for example, by brute force or dictionary attack) authentication information of a compromised user account in the system, as well as by intercepting and reusing the password hash to restore the session.
This threat is caused by the following shortcomings:
a significantly smaller volume of authentication information hash code data compared to the information itself (hash code guessing time is less than full authentication information brute force time);
weaknesses in the hash code calculation algorithm that allow its reuse for successful authentication.
Realization of this threat is possible using special software tools, and in some cases - manually
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of restoring previous vulnerable BIOS version
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of process escape from virtual machine
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a malicious program launching its own hypervisor that functions at a logical interaction level below the compromised hypervisor.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in hypervisor software that implements the function of an isolated software environment for programs functioning in it, as well as weaknesses in hardware virtualization support instructions at the processor level.
Realization of this threat leads not only to hypervisor compromise, but also to the compromise of security tools launched in the virtual environment it created, and consequently, to their inability to perform security functions in relation to malicious programs functioning under the control of their own hypervisor
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of deauthentication of authorized wireless network client
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of automatically breaking the connection of a wireless access point with an authorized wireless network client.
This threat is caused by a weakness in wireless data transmission channel network interaction technologies - information about MAC addresses of wireless clients is available to all network interaction participants.
Realization of this threat is possible if an adversary connects a device to the wireless network whose MAC address will completely match the MAC address of the compromised authorized client
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of destructive modification of program configuration/environment
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of destructive software impact on a compromised application by manipulating configuration files or libraries it uses.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in integrity control measures for configuration files or libraries used by applications.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has write permissions to file objects related to the program's configuration/environment, or the ability to redirect requests from the compromised program from protected file objects to false ones
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of destructive use of declared BIOS functionality
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of unlawful use of declared BIOS/UEFI functionality to violate the integrity of information stored on external storage media and in the computer's random access memory.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in BIOS/UEFI software intended for testing and servicing the computer (memory integrity verification tools, RAID controller management software, etc.).
Realization of this threat may be facilitated by the ability to update some BIOS/UEFI without authentication
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of prolonged retention of computing resources by users
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary limiting end users' access to computing resources by forcibly keeping them in a loaded state through repeated execution of certain destructive actions or exploitation of vulnerabilities in programs that distribute computing resources among tasks.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in load balancing and computing resource distribution mechanisms.
Realization of the threat is possible if the adversary has the ability to make requests that collectively require more execution time than user requests
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of accessing protected files using path traversal
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of accessing server local files via URL
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary sending a file system access request to a compromised browser instead of a URL request. The browser will execute this request with the rights it was granted at startup and transmit the data obtained as a result of this operation to the adversary.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for checking user-entered requests, which does not distinguish between file system access requests and URL requests.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to send requests to the browser functioning in the compromised system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of HTTP cookies access/interception/modification
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to protected information (user accounts, certificates, etc.) contained in cookies files during their storage or transmission, in read mode (confidentiality disclosure) or write mode (making changes to implement the threat of trusted user impersonation).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in cookies file protection measures: lack of input data validation by the network service using cookies files, as well as lack of encryption during cookies file transmission.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to cookies files and the compromised application does not verify the integrity of their values
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of loading non-standard operating system
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary replacing the loaded operating system by unauthorized reconfiguration in BIOS/UEFI of the access path to the operating system loader.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in BIOS/UEFI management access control technologies.
Realization of this threat is possible if the following BIOS/UEFI configuration parameter is accessible to the adversary - specification of the operating system boot source
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of DNS cache poisoning
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary redirecting network traffic through their own network node by indirectly modifying the IP and domain name correspondence tables stored in the DNS server, by generating an avalanche of possible responses to the DNS server's request to a legitimate user, or by exploiting DNS server vulnerabilities.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network interaction subject authentication verification mechanisms, as well as DNS server vulnerabilities that allow direct replacement of the DNS server's DNS cache.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges sufficient to send network requests to the DNS server
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of abusing capabilities provided to cloud service consumers
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a cloud service consumer (adversary) sending spam, unauthorized access to virtual machines of other cloud service consumers, or carrying out other destructive software actions on various systems using rented cloud server resources.
This threat is caused by the fact that a cloud service consumer can install their own software on the cloud server.
Realization of this threat is possible by installing and launching malicious software on the cloud server by the cloud service consumer. Successful realization of this threat by a cloud service consumer has a negative impact on the cloud service provider's reputation
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of abusing cloud service consumer trust
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating (accidentally or intentionally) the information security of cloud service consumers by internal threat actors of the cloud service provider.
This threat is caused by the fact that a significant part of security functions has been transferred to the responsibility of the cloud service provider, as well as the impossibility of the cloud service consumer taking protective measures against the actions of the cloud service provider's employees.
Realization of this threat is possible if cloud service consumers are not part of the organization providing these cloud services (i.e., the consumer has actually transferred their own information to the provider for processing)
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of excessive memory allocation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of allocating significant RAM resources to service malicious program requests and corresponding reduction in RAM resources available in the system for allocation in response to legitimate user program requests.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for controlling RAM allocation to various programs.
Realization of this threat is possible if malicious software is in an active state in the system
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of modifying information system components
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining network access, accessing files, implanting backdoors, etc., through unauthorized modification of software or hardware components of the information system, which will subsequently allow this adversary (or another - external one, who has discovered an unauthorized access channel into the system) to perform unauthorized actions in this system.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in measures to control the integrity of the information system's hardware configuration.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully obtains the necessary permissions in the system and the ability to connect additional peripheral equipment
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of modifying computer hardware operating modes
violator: Internal threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of modifying system and global variables
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing indirect destructive software impact on some programs or the system as a whole by modifying common system and global variables used by compromised programs.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in shared memory access control mechanisms, as well as vulnerabilities in application program modules that implement external variable integrity control.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to system and global variables and the compromised application does not verify the integrity of their values
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of XML schema distortion
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary changing the information processing algorithm of applications functioning based on XML schemas, up to bringing the application to a "denial of service" state, by modifying the XML schema transmitted between client and server.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in measures to ensure the integrity of data transmitted during client-server interaction, as well as weaknesses in the network interaction mechanism of open systems.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to network traffic transmitted between client and server and the compromised application does not verify the XML schema integrity
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of distorting input/output information to peripheral devices
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of misinforming users or automated control systems by substituting or distorting source data from sensors, keyboard, or other information input devices, as well as substituting or distorting information output to printer, operator display, or other peripheral devices.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in antivirus protection measures and input/output data accuracy control, as well as errors made during special verification checks of computer hardware.
Realization of this threat is possible if malicious software (e.g., virtual device drivers) or hardware backdoors are present in the compromised information system
violator: External threat actor with high capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of using alternative resource access paths
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of supercomputer computational resources utilization by parasitic processes
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of significantly reducing the performance of the supercomputer's computational field and the efficiency of current parallel computations on it due to consumption of supercomputer computational resources by "parasitic" processes ("child processes" from previous tasks or processes launched by malicious software).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in memory cleanup measures from "child processes" of completed tasks, as well as processes launched by malicious software.
Realization of this threat is possible if executed tasks terminate incorrectly or malicious processes are present in the supercomputer memory in an active state
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of using default identification/authentication information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary passing the authorization procedure based on identification and authentication information obtained from open sources, corresponding to the "default" account of the compromised protected object.
This threat is caused by the fact that many software and hardware-software systems have "default" accounts provided by manufacturers intended for initial system login. Moreover, on many devices identification and authentication information can be returned to the default setting after performing a hardware system parameter reset (Reset function).
Realization of this threat is possible under one of the following conditions:
the adversary has information about the protected object manufacturer/model and open sources contain information about identification and authentication information corresponding to the "default" account for the protected object;
the adversary successfully completes the procedure of identifying this information during analysis of the compromised protected object's program code
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with low capability
object: Hardware-software systems with built-in security functions

threats.name: Threat of using authorization mechanisms for privilege escalation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining access to data and functions intended for accounts with higher privileges than the adversary's, due to errors in access control system configuration parameters. In this case, the adversary does not perform destructive software impact on the system to elevate their privileges, but only exploits existing errors.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control measures for programs and files.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has any privileges in the system
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of using counterfeit BIOS digital signatures
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of installing a vulnerable version of BIOS/UEFI update or a version containing malicious software but having a digital signature.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in measures to control the trustworthiness of digital signature issuance centers.
Realization of this threat is possible if an untrustworthy certification center issues a digital signature for a BIOS/UEFI update version containing vulnerabilities or a version containing malicious software (i.e., when such a center commits forgery), as well as when an adversary substitutes a trusted update source
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of exploiting input data encoding weaknesses
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing destructive informational impact on the compromised system by manipulating input data values and their presentation form (alternative encodings, incorrect file extensions, etc.).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the input data control mechanism.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the compromised system accepts input data from the adversary;
the adversary has the ability to control one or more input data parameters
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of exploiting network/local data exchange protocol weaknesses
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to protected information transmitted in the system by destructively impacting network/local data exchange protocols in the system through violation of protocol usage rules.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the protocols themselves (algorithms embedded in them), errors made during protocol implementation, or vulnerabilities introduced by automated design/development tools.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are weaknesses in network/local data exchange protocols
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of using weak BIOS cryptographic algorithms
threats.description:
The threat consists of the difficulty in verifying the actual operating parameters and algorithms implemented in BIOS/UEFI cryptographic tools. Trust in cryptographic protection will be limited to trust in the BIOS manufacturer.
This threat is caused by the difficulty of using proprietary cryptographic algorithms in BIOS/UEFI software.
The possibility of realizing this threat reduces the reliability of assessing the actual level of system security
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of researching program operation mechanisms
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting reverse engineering of program code and further investigation of its structure, functionality, and composition in order to determine the program's operating algorithm and search for vulnerabilities in it.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the program code protection mechanism against research.
Realization of this threat is possible in the following cases:
the adversary has access to the program's source files;
the adversary has access to the program's distribution package and there is no program code protection mechanism against research
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of application research through error reports
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary investigating the compromised application's operating algorithm and its assumed structure by analyzing error reports generated by this application.
This threat is caused by placing protected information (or information whose generalization may disclose protected information about the system) in generated error reports.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has access to error reports generated by the application and there is redundancy in the data they contain
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of big data storage computational resource exhaustion
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of temporary occurrence of a "denial of service" state in big data storage.
This threat is caused by constant, difficult-to-control filling of occupied disk space due to data continuously arriving from various information sources, and weaknesses in access and information storage technologies in big data repositories.
Realization of this threat is possible if the instantaneous (current) data transfer rate exceeds the storage rate (due to insufficient communication channel bandwidth or free space allocation and incoming data storage speed) or if there is a temporary absence of free space in the storage (due to incorrect storage management or as a result of an adversary performing destructive software impact on the storage filling control mechanism by changing parameters or its operating logic)
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of exhausting keys required for BIOS updates
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of disrupting (making impossible) the BIOS/UEFI update procedure when the supply of keys necessary for its execution is exhausted.
This threat is caused by the limited set of keys required for BIOS/UEFI updates.
Realization of this threat is possible by exploiting vulnerabilities in key set update tools or by the adversary using software tools for key brute-forcing
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of jurisdictional conflict between different countries
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of refusing cross-border transmission of protected information as part of cloud service provision in accordance with local legislation requirements of countries whose residents participate in providing cloud services.
This threat is caused by the fact that depending on the legislative peculiarities of various countries whose residents participate in providing cloud services, legal measures of various jurisdictions may be used in ensuring information security.
Realization of this threat is possible if legal measures of various jurisdictions are imposed on ensuring information security during cloud service provision, contradicting each other on a number of issues
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cross-site scripting
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary injecting sections of malicious code onto the compromised system's website in such a way that it will be executed on the workstation of the user viewing this site.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the security verification mechanism when processing requests and data coming from the website.
Realization of the threat is possible if client software supports script execution and the adversary has the ability to send requests and data to the compromised system
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cross-site request forgery
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary sending a compromised user a link to a web resource containing malicious code, upon accessing which unauthorized malicious actions will be automatically performed on behalf of the compromised user.
This threat is caused by browser vulnerabilities that allow actions to be performed without confirmation or authentication from the compromised user.
Realization of the threat is possible if the compromised user saves authentication information using the browser
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud server availability disruption
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of terminating cloud services to all consumers (or a group of consumers) due to disruption of cloud infrastructure availability for them.
This threat is caused by the fact that ensuring availability is not a specific information security requirement for cloud technologies, and moreover, cloud systems are implemented in accordance with a service-oriented approach.
Realization of this threat is possible when one or more cloud servers transition to a "denial of service" state. Moreover, the ability to dynamically change the volume of cloud services provided to consumers can be used by an adversary to realize the threat. A successfully realized threat against just one cloud service will disrupt the availability of the entire cloud system
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of user data isolation violation within virtual machine
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of compromising the security of user data of programs functioning inside a virtual machine by malicious software functioning outside the virtual machine.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in hypervisor software that ensures the isolation of address space used for storing user data of programs functioning inside the virtual machine from unauthorized access by malicious software functioning outside the virtual machine.
Realization of this threat is possible if malicious code successfully crosses virtual machine boundaries not only by exploiting hypervisor vulnerabilities, but also by performing such impact from lower (relative to the hypervisor) system functioning levels
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of BIOS execution environment isolation violation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of changing BIOS/UEFI software parameters and/or operating logic through software impact from the computer's operating system or through unauthorized access to the server service processor's network interaction channel.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in BIOS/UEFI access control technologies, its administration and update functions, from the operating system or communication channels.
Realization of this threat is possible:
from the operating system side - if BIOS/UEFI has functionality for updating and/or managing BIOS/UEFI software from the operating system;
from the network side - if the compromised server service processor has sufficient privileges to manage the entire system, including modification of system servers' BIOS/UEFI, and the compromised server
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of virtual information interaction subject authentication procedure violation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of substituting a virtual information interaction subject, as well as the possibility of a state of inability to perform such interaction.
This threat is caused by the presence of multiple different mutual identification and authentication protocols for virtual, virtualized, and physical access subjects interacting with each other during data transmission both within one level of virtual infrastructure and between its levels.
Realization of this threat is possible in case of errors during authentication of virtual information interaction subjects
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of grid system operability disruption under atypical network load
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of significantly reducing grid system performance, up to temporary disruption of its operability when atypical network load appears (including caused by distributed DoS attacks, other users' activity in the network, etc.).
This threat is caused by a weakness in grid computing technologies - grid system performance has a strong dependence on communication channel load, which is a consequence of maximum territorial distribution of the grid system's computational module among all types of information systems.
Realization of this threat is possible if there is insufficient control over the state of individual grid system nodes by the grid system task dispatcher
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of information processing technology violation through unauthorized modifications to virtual machine images
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of cache data integrity violation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary placing incorrect (potentially dangerous) data in the cache of an application (e.g., browser) or service (e.g., DNS or ARP) in such a way that until the cache is updated, the compromised application (or service) will consider this data correct.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the cache data integrity control mechanism.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to cache data and the compromised application (or service) does not verify cache data integrity
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of incorrect input data format determination entering big data storage
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of distorting information stored in big data storage or refusing to save when transmitting data in certain formats to it.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in technologies for determining input data format based on additional service information (file and network packet headers, file extensions, etc.), as well as technologies for adaptive selection and application of multiformat information processing methods in big data repositories.
Realization of this threat is possible if additional service information about data for some reason does not correspond to their actual content, or the big data repository does not implement data processing methods for the received format
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of PC session recovery impossibility when exiting intermediate power states
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of losing unsaved data processed in the previous computer work session, as well as the possibility of losing time to resume computer work.
This threat is caused by errors in implementing computer software-hardware components related to power supply.
Realization of this threat is possible if it is impossible to bring the computer out of intermediate power states ("standby mode", "hibernation", etc.)
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of virtual machine image migration impossibility due to hardware and software incompatibility
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a cloud service consumer encountering insurmountable difficulties in changing cloud service provider due to technical difficulties in implementing the virtual machine image migration procedure from one cloud service provider's cloud system to another's system.
This threat is caused by the fact that each cloud service provider uses hardware and software from different manufacturers to implement their activities, some of which may use manufacturer-specific instructions, protocols, methods, switching schemes, and other implementation features.
Realization of this threat is possible if standard data exchange software interfaces (APIs) are incompatible for implementing the virtual machine image migration procedure between different cloud service providers in one or both directions.
This threat also limits the cloud service provider's ability to change hardware and software manufacturers, which may lead to information integrity and availability violations due to the cloud service provider's fault
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of inability to manage BIOS user rights
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of users unlawfully using declared BIOS/UEFI functionality intended for administrators.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control (rights distribution) technologies for BIOS/UEFI functionality between different users and administrators.
Realization of this threat is possible if there is physical access to the terminal and, if necessary, to the computer's system unit
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud service provider unfair execution of obligations
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a cloud service provider disclosing or damaging the integrity of cloud service consumers' protected information, failure to meet quality level requirements (availability level) of cloud services provided to consumers for accessing their programs or information systems migrated to the cloud.
This threat is caused by the impossibility of direct control over cloud service provider employees' actions by their consumers.
Realization of this threat is possible in cases of negligence by cloud service provider employees, insufficiency of job and other instructions for these employees, insufficiency of cloud service management and security measures, etc.
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of insecure cloud service administration
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of performing indirect destructive software impact on part or all information systems functioning in the cloud environment by intercepting control over cloud infrastructure through remote administration mechanisms.
This threat is caused by insufficient attention paid to controlling data entered by cloud service users (including authentication data), as well as vulnerabilities in insecure data exchange interfaces (APIs) used by remote administration tools.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains authentication information (during their entry in public places) of legitimate users, or exploits vulnerabilities in remote administration tools
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of poor quality infrastructure migration to cloud
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of reducing the actual security level of an information system migrating to the cloud due to errors made during migration in the course of converting its real infrastructure to cloud infrastructure.
This threat is caused by the fact that converting even part of the information system infrastructure to cloud often requires serious changes in such infrastructure (for example, in security policies and network data exchange organization).
Realization of this threat is possible in case of incompatibility of software and network interfaces or inconsistencies in security policies when transferring the information system to the cloud
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncontrolled data copying within big data storage
threats.description:
The threat consists of the difficulty of controlling all automatically created copies of information in big data storage due to temporary inconsistency of data operations.
This threat is caused by duplication (double or multiple) of data on various computational nodes included in big data storage to increase access speed to this data with a large number of read/write requests. This operation is an internal function and is "non-transparent" to end users and big data storage administrators.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are insufficient measures to control automatically created information copies applied in big data storage
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncontrolled virtual machine growth
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of limiting or disrupting availability of virtual resources for end cloud service consumers through accidental or unauthorized intentional creation by an adversary of multiple virtual machines.
This threat is caused by limited volume of disk space allocated for virtual infrastructure and weaknesses in virtual machine creation process control technologies.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has rights to create virtual machines in cloud infrastructure
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncontrolled growth of reserved computational resources
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of denying legitimate users the allocation of computer resources after an adversary unlawfully reserves all free computer resources (computational resources and memory resources).
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in virtual infrastructure management level software that implements the function of distributing computer resources among users.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to virtual infrastructure management level software that implements the function of distributing computer resources among users
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncontrolled information destruction by big data storage
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of deleting some processed data from storage without notifying the end user or administrator.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the automatic data deletion mechanism that does not meet certain requirements (maximum "lifetime" in storage, final inconsistency with other data, creating a copy elsewhere, etc.).
Realization of this threat is possible if there are insufficient measures implemented in big data storage to control automatic data deletion
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of incorrect transaction data structure specification
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary (database client) committing forgery by interrupting a transaction or substituting a transaction identifier. In the first case, incomplete transaction execution occurs, and in the second case, the user forcibly terminates the transaction by changing its ID and reporting that the transaction was not conducted, thereby provoking repeated transaction execution.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for controlling transaction continuity and integrity of data transmitted during the transaction between the database and its client
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of incorrect transparent proxy server use via browser plugins
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of redirecting or copying data processed by the browser through a transparent proxy server connected to the browser as a plugin.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the browser settings access control mechanism.
Realization is possible if the adversary successfully enables the transparent proxy server usage mode in browser settings, for example, as a result of implementing a cross-site scripting threat
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of incorrect software and hardware functionality usage
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of using declared capabilities of software and hardware in a certain (non-standard, incorrect) way with the goal of destructively impacting the information system and the information it processes.
This threat is related to weaknesses in the data and command processing mechanism entered by users.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has access to software and hardware
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of incorrect licensing policy implementation in cloud
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of denying cloud service consumers remote access to rented software (i.e., loss of SaaS cloud service availability) due to the cloud service provider's fault.
This threat is caused by insufficient development of the issue of managing licensing policies for using software from various manufacturers in the cloud.
Realization of this threat is possible if the software usage licensing policy is based on limiting the number of its installations or the number of its users, and created virtual machines with licensed software are used many times
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncertainty in responsibility distribution between cloud roles
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of significant disagreements between cloud service provider and consumer on issues related to determining their rights and obligations regarding information security.
This threat is caused by the absence of a sufficient set of measures to control responsibility distribution between different roles in terms of data ownership, access control, cloud infrastructure support, etc.
The possibility of realizing this threat increases when using cloud services provided by other providers (i.e., when using a cloud service delivery scheme involving intermediaries)
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of uncertainty regarding cloud security assurance responsibility
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of not implementing a number of information protection measures by both the cloud service provider and their consumer.
This threat is caused by the absence of a clear division of responsibility for ensuring information security between the consumer and the cloud service provider.
Realization of this threat is possible if there is insufficient documentary division of areas of responsibility between parties participating in cloud service provision, as well as the absence of documentary definition of responsibility for non-compliance with security requirements
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of unlawful accidental or intentional user access to information not intended for them, and further use of it to achieve their own or destructive goals assigned to them by other persons (organizations).
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in access control systems, errors in configuration parameters of these systems, or the absence of such systems.
Realization of this threat does not imply installation and use by the adversary of special malicious software. Access can be obtained by viewing information from other users' monitor screens, from printed documents, by eavesdropping on conversations, etc.
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unlawful/incorrect use of application interaction interface
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing destructive software impact on APIs to implement functions initially not provided for by the compromised application (for example, using debugging functions from the API).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for checking input data and API commands used by software.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has access to the API and the compromised application lacks a mechanism for checking input data and commands
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unlawful actions in communication channels
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary making changes to network protocol operation by adding or removing data from the information stream to influence the compromised system's operation or gain access to confidential information transmitted over the communication channel.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network protocols consisting of the absence of verification of received data integrity and authenticity.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary gains unauthorized access to network traffic
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of continuous cloud infrastructure modernization
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of introducing vulnerabilities and weaknesses into the cloud system along with adding new software or hardware. A system considered secure at the commissioning stage can no longer be considered as such after its modernization.
This threat is caused by the fact that, firstly, cloud service providers provide the ability for cloud service consumers to select and/or change the initial composition of cloud infrastructure software during service provision, and secondly, with intensive connection of new consumers, cloud infrastructure modernization can occur several times a year.
Realization of this threat is possible if the time until the next modernization does not exceed the time to assess the system's compliance with security requirements in the absence of a cloud service management and security assurance system (cloud management system)
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized recovery of deleted protected information
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized disabling or bypassing BIOS write protection mechanism
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of injecting malicious program code into BIOS/UEFI after erroneous or malicious disabling by the user of the BIOS/UEFI write protection mechanism, as well as the possibility of installing an unsigned update bypassing the BIOS/UEFI write protection mechanism.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in measures for access control to managing the BIOS/UEFI write protection mechanism, as well as vulnerabilities in the BIOS/UEFI update mechanism leading to buffer overflow.
Realization of this threat is possible under one of the following conditions:
the BIOS/UEFI write protection mechanism is disabled;
the adversary successfully exploits a vulnerability in the BIOS/UEFI update mechanism leading to buffer overflow
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to active and/or passive virtual and/or physical network equipment from physical and/or virtual network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of malicious programs modifying the operating algorithm of network equipment software and/or its configuration parameters by exploiting vulnerabilities in the software and/or firmware of this equipment.
This threat is caused by limited functional capabilities (presence of weaknesses) of active and/or passive virtual and/or physical network equipment included in the virtual infrastructure, the presence of a fixed network address for this equipment.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are vulnerabilities in the network equipment's software and/or firmware
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to authentication information
threats.description: The threat consists of the possibility of extracting passwords, usernames, or other credentials from computer RAM or theft (copying) of password files (including those stored in plain text) from machine storage media
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to virtual transmission channels
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing unauthorized interception of network node traffic that is inaccessible using network technologies other than virtualization network technologies, through incorrect use of such technologies.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in flow control, firewall, and access control measures implemented for virtualization network technologies (used to build virtual data transmission channels).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to interact using virtualization network technologies
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to hypervisor from virtual machine and/or physical network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary bringing all (if there is one hypervisor) or part (if several interacting hypervisors are used) of the virtual infrastructure to a "denial of service" state by performing destructive software impact on the hypervisor from virtual machines launched in the virtual environment it created, or by impacting the hypervisor through its connection to the physical computing network.
This threat is caused by the presence of many diverse interfaces for interaction between the hypervisor and virtual machine and/or physical network, hypervisor vulnerabilities, as well as software vulnerabilities and limited functional capabilities of hardware used to ensure its operability.
Realization of this threat is possible in one of the following cases:
the adversary has privileges sufficient to perform destructive software impact from virtual machines;
the hypervisor has an active interface for interaction with the physical computing network
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to data beyond reserved address space, including that allocated for virtual hardware
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a malicious program functioning inside a virtual machine violating the integrity of the program code of its own and/or other virtual machines functioning under the control of the same hypervisor, as well as changing its (their) configuration parameters.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in hypervisor software that ensures isolation of address space used for storing not only protected information and program code of programs processing it, but also program code implementing virtual hardware (virtual data processing, storage, and transmission devices) from unauthorized access by malicious programs functioning inside a virtual machine.
Realization of this threat is possible if malicious program functioning inside a virtual machine successfully gains unauthorized access to data stored beyond the address space reserved for user data of this virtual machine
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected virtual machines from virtual and/or physical network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing destructive software impact on virtual machines from virtual and/or physical network using both standard (non-virtual) network technologies and virtualization network technologies.
This threat is caused by the fact that created virtual machines have network addresses and the ability to network with other subjects.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has information about the virtual machine's network address, as well as the virtual machine's current activity at the time the adversary performs destructive software impact
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected virtual machines from other virtual machines
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of performing destructive software impact on protected virtual machines from other virtual machines using various data exchange mechanisms between virtual machines implemented by the hypervisor and activated in the system.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the data exchange mechanism between virtual machines and vulnerabilities in its implementation in a specific hypervisor.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges sufficient to use various data exchange mechanisms between virtual machines implemented in the hypervisor and activated in the system
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected virtual devices from virtual and/or physical network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary remotely gaining unauthorized access to virtual devices from virtual and/or physical network using various network technologies used for data exchange in a system built using virtualization technologies.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network software interfaces of hypervisors designed for remote management of the composition and configuration of virtual devices created (being created) by these hypervisors.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges sufficient to exchange data in a system built using virtualization technologies
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability
object: Virtual storage/processing and data transmission devices

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to local computer through grid system client
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing network login to a grid system node with the rights of one of the accounts corresponding to task management system software processes, followed by gaining access to the private part of cryptographic certificates used to establish communication in the grid system.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in the grid system client (client software installed on grid system nodes), exploitation of which allows the adversary to perform read and write operations on local computer file system objects, send signals to software processes (including termination signals), read and write operations in process memory corresponding to middleware and grid tasks, open network connections in local and external grid system nodes.
Realization of this threat is possible if malicious program code is injected into the task management system. In fact, the presence of unknown software (grid system client) on a grid system node owned by the node owner, performing unknown calculations, is a "black box" through which (by exploiting vulnerabilities or software backdoors) the adversary can perform unlawful actions against protected information stored on the grid system node (owner's personal information)
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to computational field segments
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to source data, intermediate and final calculation results of other supercomputer users, as well as accidental or intentional destructive impact of some task solution processes on processes and results of solving other computational tasks.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for controlling subject access to supercomputer computational field segments.
Realization of this threat is possible when different supercomputer user tasks are executed on one supercomputer computational field
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability
object: Virtual storage/processing and data transmission devices

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized system access via wireless channels
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining access to all compromised information system resources through wireless data transmission channels used in its composition.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in identification/authentication protocols (such as WEP, WPA and WPA2, AES) used to access wireless equipment.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has specialized software implementing functions for exploiting vulnerabilities in wireless network identification/authentication protocols, and is located at a signal reception point of the compromised wireless network
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to data storage system from virtual and/or physical network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of performing destructive software impact on virtual data storage devices and/or virtual disks (which are both segments of virtual disk space created by a separate virtual device, and a unified virtual disk space created by logical combination of several virtual data storage devices).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in technologies used for distributing information across various virtual data storage devices and/or virtual disks, as well as weaknesses in unified virtual disk space technology. These weaknesses are related to high complexity of algorithms for ensuring consistency of actions for distributing information within a unified virtual disk space, as well as interaction with virtual and physical data transmission channels to ensure operation within a single disk space.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has special software tools capable of exploiting weaknesses in technologies used to build the data storage system (network technologies, information distribution technologies, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability
object: Virtual storage/processing and data transmission devices

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected information stored in virtual space
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating the confidentiality of information contained in distributed files containing protected information by recovering data from distributed files from their many separate fragments using software and information technologies for processing distributed information.
This threat is caused by the fact that due to the use of multiple virtualization technologies designed for working with data (data distribution within virtual and logical disks, data distribution between such disks, data distribution between physical and virtual drives of unified disk space, allocation of disk space areas as separate disks, etc.), almost all files are stored as multiple separate segments.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are insufficient or absent measures to ensure confidentiality of information stored on separate drives
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized modification of authentication information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to other users' authentication information using standard operating system tools or special software tools.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control measures for authentication information.
Realization of this threat can facilitate further adversary penetration into the system under the account of the compromised user
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized use of BIOS privileged functions
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary using potentially dangerous BIOS/UEFI capabilities.
This threat is caused by the presence of potentially dangerous functionality in BIOS/UEFI
violator: External threat actor with high capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized copying of protected information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary unlawfully obtaining a copy of protected information by performing a sequence of unlawful actions, including: unauthorized access to protected information, copying found information to removable media (or to another location accessible to the adversary outside the system).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control mechanisms for protected information and control of person access in the controlled zone.
Realization of this threat is possible in the absence of cryptographic protection measures or when taking a copy during processing of protected information in unencrypted form
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized registry editing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary making changes to the registry used by the compromised application that affect the functioning of individual application services or the application as a whole. The registry here means not only the Microsoft Windows operating system registry, but any registry used by the application. Registry modification can be both a stage in performing another destructive impact and a primary goal.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the access control mechanism consisting of assigning programs implementing it excessively high privileges when working with the registry.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains rights to work with the registry editing program
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized user account creation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary creating an additional user account in the system and its further use for their own unlawful purposes (logging into the system with the rights of this account and performing destructive actions against the compromised system or from the compromised system against other systems).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control mechanisms for protected information.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are rights to run specialized programs for editing files containing information about system users (with remote access) or standard access control tools from the operating system (with local access)
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized deletion of protected information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary causing economic, informational, moral, and other types of damage to the owner and operator of unlawfully deleted information by performing destructive software or physical impact on machine storage media.
This threat is caused by insufficiency of measures to ensure protected information availability in the system, as well as the presence of vulnerabilities in software implementing these measures.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains system rights to erase data or physical access to machine storage media at a distance sufficient to have an effective destructive impact
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized remote out-of-band access to hardware
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary obtaining system management privileges by using remote out-of-band (via independent auxiliary TCP/IP channel) access.
This threat is caused by the impossibility of controlling the mechanism implementing remote access functions at the hardware level at the operating system level, as well as independence from the power state of hardware devices, since this mechanism provides a procedure for remote power on/off of hardware devices.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
presence in the system of hardware supporting remote out-of-band access technology;
system connection to public networks (Internet)
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized buffer management
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to data contained in the exchange buffer for the purpose of familiarizing themselves with information stored there or performing destructive software impact on the system (for example, buffer overflow to execute arbitrary malicious code).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the exchange buffer access control mechanism, as well as weaknesses in input data verification mechanisms.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains unauthorized access to the RAM segment of the compromised object where the exchange buffer is located
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized synchronization and state management
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized pointer management
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary executing arbitrary malicious code on behalf of the compromised application or bringing the compromised application to a "denial of service" state by changing pointers to memory cells containing specific data used by the compromised application.
This threat is related to vulnerabilities in memory access control tools and memory cell content integrity control.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to modify pointers used by the compromised application
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud infrastructure security policy inconsistency
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing destructive software impacts on both cloud service providers and consumers.
This threat is caused by insufficient development of the issue of managing cloud infrastructure element security policies due to significant cloud infrastructure distribution.
Realization of this threat is possible when using different security policies that are inconsistent with each other (for example, one security tool may deny access while another grants access)
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of big data access rule inconsistency
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of providing erroneous unauthorized access to protected information or, conversely, the possibility of denying legitimate users access to protected information due to errors made when delegating privileges to them by other legitimate big data storage users.
This threat is caused by insufficiency of measures to differentiate and coordinate information access for various users in big data storage.
Realization of this threat is possible when using different security policies that are inconsistent with each other (for example, one security tool may deny access while another grants access)
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of open port discovery and identification of bound network services
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary determining the network port state of the compromised system (so-called port scanning) to obtain information about the possibility of establishing connection with the compromised system through these ports, the system configuration itself and installed information security tools, as well as other information allowing the adversary to determine through which ports destructive software impacts can be performed directly, and through which - only using special firewall bypass techniques.
This threat is related to vulnerabilities and configuration errors in firewall and network traffic filtering tools used in the compromised system.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has connection to the compromised computing network and specialized software implementing port scanning and network traffic analysis functions
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of host discovery
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary scanning the computing network to identify operating network nodes.
This threat is related to weaknesses in network interaction mechanisms providing network clients with open technical information about network nodes, as well as vulnerabilities and configuration errors in firewall and network traffic filtering tools used in the compromised system.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has connection to the compromised computing network and specialized software implementing network traffic analysis functions
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of bypassing incorrectly configured authentication mechanisms
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary obtaining privileges in the system without going through the authentication procedure by performing actions that violate conditions for correct authentication tool operation (for example, entering data in an unsupported format).
This threat is caused by incorrect configuration parameter values of authentication tools and/or absence of input data control.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are errors in the set parameter values of authentication mechanism settings
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud infrastructure public accessibility
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of unauthorized access to one cloud service consumer's protected information by another.
This threat is caused by the fact that due to cloud technology features, cloud service consumers have to share the same cloud infrastructure.
Realization of this threat is possible if errors are made when dividing cloud infrastructure elements among cloud service consumers, as well as when isolating their resources and separating data from each other
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of indirect program group management through shared data
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary indirectly changing the operating algorithm of a group of programs using common data simultaneously by intercepting control over one of them (RAM cells, global variables, configuration files, etc.).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the mechanism for controlling changes made to common data by each program in the group.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully intercepts control over one of the programs in a group of programs using common data
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of protected object type identification
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary analyzing output data of the compromised system using a method that allows determining exact values of parameters and properties uniquely inherent to the compromised system (this method is known as "fingerprinting"). Using this method does not cause direct harm to the compromised system. However, information collected in this way allows the adversary to identify weaknesses in the compromised system that can be used later in realizing other threats.
This threat is caused by errors in firewall configuration parameters, as well as the absence of input and output data control mechanisms.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has information about the relationship between output data and the compromised system configuration (software documentation, data transmission standards, specifications, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of computing network topology identification
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary determining the compromised system's network node state (so-called network scanning) to obtain information about the compromised computing network topology, which can be used later in attempts to realize other threats.
This threat is related to weaknesses in network interaction mechanisms providing network clients with open technical information about network nodes, as well as firewall vulnerabilities (operating algorithm and network traffic filtering rule configuration).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has the ability to connect to the researched computing network and has specialized software implementing network traffic analysis functions
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of refusal to load input data of unknown format by big data storage
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of big data storage refusing to accept input data of unknown format from a legitimate user.
This threat is caused by the absence of an independent (automatic) adaptation mechanism to new data formats in big data storage.
Realization of this threat is possible if a request is received to load input data of unknown format into the storage
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of denial of service by supercomputer data storage system
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of significantly slowing down the work of all supercomputer user terminal sessions, up to achieving a "denial of service" state for the entire supercomputer when the maximum achievable load on the supercomputer parallel file system is exceeded.
This threat is caused by a significant increase in the number and volume of data saved to storage for some computational tasks.
Realization of this threat is possible with intensive file input-output in the supercomputer cluster file subsystem based on using a parallel file system
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of control sensor disconnection
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary ensuring informational isolation of the security system by interrupting the communication channel with control sensors monitoring system state parameters, or disrupting the sensors themselves.
