In this case, the system will stop responding to both security incidents (if the disconnected sensors were part of the security system, for example, motion sensors) and other types of incidents (for example, when disconnecting fire alarm sensors, pressure increase in hydraulic units, etc.).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in information protection measures in automated process control systems, as well as the presence of vulnerabilities in software implementing these measures.
Realization of this threat is possible if access (physical or software) is obtained to security system communication lines with control sensors or to the sensors themselves
violator: External threat actor with high capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of hypervisor update error
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of enumerating all application settings and parameters
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining access to additional hidden functionality (information about which was not published by the developer) or bringing the system to a "denial of service" state when the adversary sets certain program configuration parameters, reaching such parameter values by enumerating all possible combinations.
This threat is caused by software vulnerabilities that manifest with incorrect configuration.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to modify software configuration. When realizing this threat, unlike other similar threats, the adversary acts "blindly" - by simple enumeration of all possible combinations
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of grid system overload with computational tasks
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of reducing resource center throughput when a large number of tasks are sent by one user (adversary) accidentally or intentionally, which may make it impossible for other grid system users to queue tasks for execution.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in grid system control measures for the number of computational tasks launched by grid system users.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has rights to queue tasks for grid system execution
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of data transmission via covert channels
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of transmitting prohibited commands to CNC equipment
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary damaging executive mechanisms, workpiece and/or processing tool of computer numerical control (CNC) equipment by transmitting commands to it that lead to movement of the processing tool beyond permissible limits (i.e., commands prohibited for CNC equipment).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in measures to protect CNC equipment from executing prohibited commands.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to transmit commands to CNC equipment or the ability to modify commands transmitted by a legitimate user
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of hardware and software-hardware computing equipment reboot
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a user (adversary) resetting RAM state (memory zeroing) by accidentally or intentionally rebooting individual devices, units, or the system as a whole.
This threat is caused by the RAM property of resetting its state during power off and reboot.
Realization of this threat is possible both by hardware method (pressing a button) and by software (locally or remotely) under the following conditions:
presence of open user work sessions in the system;
the adversary has system rights (or physical capability) to perform forced reboot
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of integer variable overflow
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary causing malfunctions in the compromised application by submitting data in an unsupported format to its input interfaces or performing an operation with it that will result in data in a format unsupported by the compromised application.
This threat is caused by software vulnerabilities related to insufficient verification by such applications of input data correctness, as well as the fact that operators of any software are capable of correctly processing only certain data types (for example, only integers or only positive numbers).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has:
information about the nomenclature of input (or processed) data formats supported by the compromised application;
the ability to interact with the compromised application's input interface
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of intercepting input/output information to peripheral devices
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to information input and output to peripheral devices by intercepting data processed by peripheral device controllers.
This threat is caused by insufficiency of information protection measures against leakage and data flow control, as well as the impossibility of protecting information input and output to peripheral devices using cryptographic means (since presenting information to system users must be done in an understandable form).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has privileges to install and run specialized malicious programs implementing "keylogger" functions (for the adversary to obtain user passwords), virtual printer drivers (intercepting documents containing protected information), etc.
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of intercepting data transmitted over computing network
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to the compromised computing network traffic in passive (sometimes active) mode (i.e., "eavesdrop on network traffic") to collect and analyze information that can be used later to realize other threats, remaining an invisible (covert) recipient of intercepted data when realizing this threat. Additionally, the adversary can conduct research on other types of data flows, for example, radio signals.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network interaction mechanisms providing third-party users with open data about the compromised system, as well as network software configuration errors.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the adversary has access to the compromised computing network;
inability of technologies used to implement data transmission to prevent the possibility of covert eavesdropping on the data flow
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of privileged stream hijacking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to a data stream created by an application with additional privileges (privileged data stream) through synchronous (calling a privileged function that returns an incorrect value) or asynchronous (creating callbacks, manipulating pointers, etc.) destructive software impact on it.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in software that uses code sections executed with additional rights inherited by created privileged streams (presence of erroneous pointers, incorrect memory deallocation, etc.).
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the compromised application has code sections requiring execution with rights exceeding those of regular users;
the adversary possesses privileges allowing modification of input data to the compromised application
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of privileged process hijacking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining control of a process with high privileges (for example, inherited from a user or group of users performing the role of administrators of the compromised system) to execute arbitrary malicious code with the rights of the compromised process.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in software performing access control functions (in the algorithm or configuration parameters), leading to incorrect distribution of access rights within the tree of inherited processes.
Realization of this threat is possible if one of the following conditions is met:
successful introduction by the adversary of incorrect data leading to buffer overflow or implementation of certain types of software injections;
the adversary possesses privileges to launch system utilities intended for process management
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of hypervisor control hijacking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to information, software, and computing resources reserved and managed by the hypervisor by obtaining the right to control the hypervisor through exploitation of hypervisor management console vulnerabilities.
This threat is caused by the presence in the hypervisor management console of program interfaces for interaction with other access subjects (processes, programs) and, as a consequence, the possibility of unauthorized access to this console (virtualization level program), as well as insufficient measures for access control to this console.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses rights to interact with the hypervisor management console
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of virtualization environment control hijacking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to information, software, and computing resources reserved and managed by all hypervisors implementing the virtualization environment by obtaining the right to control these hypervisors through exploitation of virtual infrastructure management tool console vulnerabilities.
This threat is caused by the presence in the virtual infrastructure management tool console, implemented within one of the virtual machines, of program interfaces for interaction with other access subjects (processes, programs) and, as a consequence, the possibility of unauthorized access to this console (virtualization management level program), as well as insufficient measures for access control to this console.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses rights to interact with the virtual infrastructure management tool console
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of system registry corruption
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of disrupting the availability of part of the functionality or the entire information system due to corruption of the registry used in its operation as a result of incorrect termination of the operating system (uncontrolled reboot, device driver errors, etc.), violation of the integrity of files containing registry data, file system errors on the storage medium, or as a result of adversarial destructive software impact on file objects containing the registry.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control measures for files containing registry data, measures for backup and integrity control of such files, as well as measures for restoring registry functionality due to operating system failures.
Realization of this threat is possible under one of the following conditions:
occurrence of errors in the operation of individual processes or the entire operating system;
the adversary possesses access rights to the registry or files containing registry data
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of privilege escalation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting destructive software impact on the compromised process (or system) or on other processes (or systems) on its behalf by exploiting additional rights improperly obtained by the adversary to control the compromised object.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in software performing access control functions (in the algorithm or configuration parameters).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses software (of the "exploit" type) specially designed to realize this threat in the compromised system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of BIOS password brute force
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to BIOS/UEFI settings by entering the BIOS/UEFI console with a password guessed programmatically or "manually" using brute force methods or dictionary attack.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the authentication mechanism implemented in BIOS/UEFI consoles.
Realization of this threat is possible in one of the following cases:
the adversary can physically access the computer and has the ability to reboot it;
the adversary possesses special software for BIOS/UEFI password brute force and system privileges to install and run such tools
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of security event log record forgery
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary modifying security event logs of the compromised system (deleting records compromising the adversary or forging records about events that did not occur) to mislead its administrators or conceal traces of other threat realization.
This threat is caused by insufficient measures for access control to the security event log.
Realization of this threat is possible in one of the following cases:
the security event logging technology allows their editing and the adversary possesses the necessary privileges for this;
the security event logging technology does not allow their editing, but the adversary possesses privileges necessary to write to log files, as well as special software capable of processing log files in the format used in the compromised system
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of wireless network connection bypassing authentication
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary intercepting wireless network traffic or other unlawful actions by legitimizing the adversary's own connection to the wireless network in semi-automatic mode (for example, WPS) without entering an encryption key.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the wireless device authentication procedure during semi-automatic connection.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has physical access to a wireless access point supporting semi-automatic connection mode
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of wireless client or access point spoofing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary obtaining authentication or other protected information transmitted during automatic connection of wireless access points or client software to trusted network interaction subjects spoofed by the adversary.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the network interaction subject authentication mechanism for wireless access.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary deploys a client or wireless access point with specially configured operating parameters (such as MAC address, name, data transmission standard used, etc.) within accessibility range of compromised wireless access devices
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of user action substitution through deception
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing unlawful actions in the system on behalf of another user using social engineering methods (deceiving the user, imposing false beliefs) or technical methods (using transparent buttons, substituting labels on control elements, etc.)
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the user interaction interface or user errors.
Realization of this threat is possible if the compromised user has rights to perform operations the adversary needs from them
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of trusted user spoofing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary impersonating a legitimate user and performing data reception/transmission on their behalf. This threat can be characterized as "client action imitation."
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network interaction technologies that often do not allow verification of the authenticity of the information source/recipient.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has a connection to the computing network, as well as information about network device configuration, type of software used, etc.
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of BIOS software backup substitution
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of indirect introduction by an adversary of malicious code into the BIOS/UEFI of the compromised computer by awaiting or creating the necessity to perform a procedure to restore a previous version of BIOS/UEFI software previously substituted by the adversary.
This threat is caused by insufficient access control measures and integrity control of BIOS/UEFI software backup copies.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the adversary successfully substituted the BIOS/UEFI software backup copy;
the need arose to restore a previous version of BIOS/UEFI software (this condition may occur both accidentally and be provoked by the adversary)
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of network resource content substitution
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to protected data of network users or conducting various fraudulent actions by covertly substituting the content of stored (sites, web pages) or transmitted (emails, network packets) data over the network.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network interaction technologies that often do not allow verification of the authenticity of electronic message content.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has access rights to network resources and the network user lacks measures to ensure their integrity
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of network access subject spoofing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to protected data of network users or conducting various fraudulent actions by covertly substituting information about the message sender in network requests sent by the compromised user. This threat can be characterized as "server action imitation."
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network interaction technologies that often do not allow verification of the authenticity of the information source.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully impersonates a legitimate sender (for example, using fake phishing websites). The key difference from "threat of network resource content substitution" is that in this case the adversary does not change the original content of an electronic resource (website, email), but only service information
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of obtaining preliminary information about the protected object
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary disclosing protected information about the security state of the compromised system, its configuration and potential vulnerabilities, etc., by conducting activities to collect and analyze available information about the system.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in network software that allow obtaining information about the configuration of individual programs or the system as a whole (lack of input data control, presence of open network ports, incorrect security policy settings, etc.).
Realization of this threat is possible if information about the compromised system is obtained using at least one of the following methods of studying the compromised system:
analysis of system reactions to network (including syntactically incorrect or non-standard) requests to open network services in the system, which may cause unhandled exceptions with detailed error messages containing protected information (about stack trace, system configuration, network packet routing path)
analysis of system reactions to string URI requests (including incorrect SQL queries, alternative file access paths).
This threat differs from the threat of data interception and other data collection threats in that the adversary actively queries the compromised system rather than simply observing it
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of obtaining information about wireless device owner
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary disclosing information about the geographical movements of the compromised user at certain time periods, including identifying their place of work, residence, etc. Obtaining such information can be used by the adversary later to realize threats in information systems to which the compromised user has access.
This threat is caused by weak protection of identification information of wireless access points when they connect to the Internet.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has access to identification data of stationary wireless access points with which the compromised user's wireless device automatically interacts
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of loss of trust in cloud service provider
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of reducing the level of security and allowing additional errors in ensuring the security of information protected in the cloud system due to irreparable resource drain from the cloud service provider in connection with loss of trust from cloud service consumers.
This threat is caused by the fact that due to disclosure of information security incidents related to the cloud service provider, there is a loss of trust in such provider from cloud service consumers, and, as a consequence, the need arises for avalanche allocation by the cloud service provider of resources (human, technical, financial) to solve problems arising in this situation (multiple user consultations, urgent revision of security policies, security system modernization, etc.), which can not only cause a shortage of resources to ensure the current level of information security, but also provoke "hasty" new errors.
Realization of this threat is possible if single or multiple facts about information security incidents related to the cloud service provider that caused significant losses to its clients are disclosed
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of data loss and leakage processed in the cloud
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating confidentiality, integrity, and availability of protected information of cloud service consumers processed in the cloud system.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in information protection measures for information processed in the cloud system.
Realization of this threat is possible if the cloud service provider (incorrect selection or configuration of protection tools) or consumer (password loss, electronic key, login from an insecure console) makes errors in ensuring the security of protected information
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of information loss due to big data storage node inconsistency
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of allowing errors when copying protected information during distributed data storage on various nodes of big data storage due to inconsistency in their operation, leading to the inability of a legitimate user to access blocks or all protected information.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in data replication mechanisms implemented in big data storage nodes.
Realization of this threat is possible under conditions of disconnection or disabling of one or more nodes through special software impacts on big data storage nodes, as well as occurrence of technical or software failures in the operation of their components
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of loss of cloud resource control
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating contractual obligations on the part of the cloud service provider towards their consumer due to the significant complexity of building an effective cloud resource management system for the cloud system, especially one using cloud resources of other cloud service providers.
This threat is caused by the complexity of determining the logical and physical location of cloud resources, insufficient physical access control measures to data storage, backup, etc., as well as the need to account for features of information protection legislation in countries where cloud service providers performing the role of subcontractors in providing ordered cloud services are residents.
Realization of this threat is possible if fulfillment of cloud system functionality requirements is hindered (or becomes impossible) due to legal norms of other countries participating in cross-border cloud traffic transmission
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of loss of own infrastructure control when migrating to the cloud
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of allowing errors in managing the cloud service consumer's system infrastructure migrated to the cloud on the part of the cloud service provider due to their lack of information about the specific system management features, as well as due to the cloud service consumer possessing such information lacking the ability to conduct the full range of work on managing their own system infrastructure in connection with its migration to the cloud.
This threat is caused by the impossibility of reliable assessment by the cloud service consumer of the real level of security provided by the cloud service provider regarding the cloud service consumer's protected information, due to closure to consumers of information about technologies, software and technical solutions used by the cloud service provider, as well as specific protection tool configuration parameters.
Realization of this threat is possible in cases of transferring part of the cloud service consumer's system management functions to the cloud service provider (when migrating part or all of the system to the cloud)
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of physical protection bypass
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting practically any destructive actions against the compromised information system upon obtaining physical access to the system's computing hardware by bypassing the physical access control system organized in the enterprise building.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in the physical access control system (lack of locks in premises, personnel errors, etc.).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully applies any method of penetrating the facility (deceiving personnel, lock picking, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of denial of service attack
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of the compromised system denying access to legitimate users due to an avalanche-like increase in the number of network connections to this system or due to exploitation of network protocol implementation deficiencies.
This threat is caused by the fact that processing each network request consumes part of the system's resources, as well as weaknesses in network technologies related to limited network request flow processing speed, insufficient connection management control measures, and network protocol implementation errors.
Realization of this threat is possible if the volume of requests exceeds the volume of resources available for their processing in the compromised system, or if there are network protocol implementation errors (for example, IPv6 address formation based on MAC address, IP address availability determination, PPP interface integrity control function use, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud service provider lock-in
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of difficult-to-resolve (or even unsolvable) technical, organizational, legal, or other problems preventing the cloud service consumer from changing their provider.
This threat is caused by lack of compatibility between data formats and software interfaces used in cloud infrastructures of different cloud service providers.
Realization of this threat is possible if the cloud service provider uses non-standard software or virtual machine image format and lacks tools to convert virtual machine images from the format they use to another (used by another provider)
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of cloud service suspension due to technical failures
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of degraded cloud service quality (or even denial of service to end consumers) due to technical failures of at least one cloud service provider (in the chain of intermediaries providing cloud services to their end consumer), as well as due to significant delays or losses in data transmission channels leased by the consumer or cloud service providers.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the procedure for monitoring technical maintenance performance and compliance with operating modes of technical means of the cloud information system.
Realization of this threat is possible if there are no backup mechanisms for information processing, storage, and transmission means included in the cloud information system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of software-induced failure of storage, processing and/or I/O/transmission means
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary interrupting information processing technology in the compromised system by conducting destructive software (local or remote) impact on storage (external, removable, and internal drives), processing (processor, device controllers, etc.), and/or input/output/transmission means (keyboard, etc.), resulting in the protected object entering a "denial of service" state. Recovery from this state may be impossible through system reboot and may require repair and restoration work.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in firmware of storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means, as well as inability of storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means to remain long in maximum permissible value mode (system bus frequency, central processor, number of read/write accesses, and other parameters).
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has rights to send commands or specially formed input data to storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of BIOS password software reset
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to BIOS/UEFI settings after computer reboot by entering an "empty" password.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in operating system access control measures for the BIOS/UEFI password reset function.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the BIOS/UEFI software has an active interface for software password reset directly from the operating system;
the adversary possesses special software implementing password reset, as well as operating system rights to install and run such tools
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of software integrity check bypass
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary introducing malicious software into the compromised system by deceptively redirecting user or program requests to their own network resource containing malicious software for "manual" or "automatic" download with subsequent installation in the compromised system on behalf of the user or their programs.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in software file integrity verification mechanisms and/or verification of the authenticity of their source.
Realization of this threat is possible if deceptive techniques of one of the following methods are successfully used:
"manual method" – the adversary, using deceptive mechanisms, convinces the user to follow a link to the adversary's network resource, which leads to malicious code execution on the user's computer, or convinces the user to independently download and install a malicious program (for example, disguised as a game or antivirus tool);
"automatic method" – the adversary conducts destructive impact by redirecting the compromised program's automatic update function to their own malicious server
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of direct memory access in supercomputer compute field
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary's process functioning in the supercomputer's compute field reading protected data from RAM allocated for a parallel (compromised) process using remote direct memory access operations.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the direct RAM access protocol used to access the memory segment allocated for a remote parallel process functioning in the supercomputer's compute field.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully gains access to input/output data of parallel processes in the supercomputer's compute field
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized escalated privileges propagation across grid system
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of automatic propagation throughout the grid system of privileges obtained by an adversary on one node without authorization.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in grid system client software and weaknesses in the user rights assignment mechanism implemented in middleware.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully escalates their rights on one grid system node
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of big data storage access control system automatic management failure
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of situations related to errors in automatic assignment of user access rights (granting additional privileges, erroneous inheritance, accidental restoration of "inactive" accounts, etc.).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in control measures over a large number (from thousands, and in some cases up to several million) of user accounts by security administrators.
Realization of this threat is possible if failures or errors occur in the big data storage access control system
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability
object: Big data storage access control system

threats.name: Threat of specially modified file processing failure
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary performing various unlawful actions on behalf of compromised applications by causing failure in their operation through modification of files or their metadata processed by compromised programs.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the integrity verification mechanism for processed files and correctness of data contained in them.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the adversary possesses information about file formats and values that cause compromised application operation failure when processed;
a mechanism for intercepting control over software failure processing by the adversary has been successfully created in the compromised system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of BIOS update process failure
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of computer failure due to introduction of critical errors in BIOS/UEFI software as a result of disruption of its update process.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in BIOS/UEFI software update control technologies.
Realization of this threat is possible during computer repair and maintenance both when installing a correct/compatible update version (due to failures, interference, etc.) and when installing a corrupted/incompatible update version (due to lack of integrity and compatibility verification mechanism)
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of web service scanning developed using WSDL
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary obtaining information about the current web service configuration and vulnerabilities in it by investigating the web server's WSDL interface.
This threat is caused by insufficient information confidentiality measures implemented in WSDL services providing detailed information about ports, services, and connections available to users.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has network access to the investigated network resource and special network scanning software
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of authentication information deletion
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of denying legitimate users access to information resources, as well as the possibility of an adversary obtaining privileges of the compromised user by resetting (clearing, deleting) their authentication information.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in the access control policy for authentication information and user account management tools.
Realization of this threat is possible if one of the following conditions is met:
standard user account management tools have authentication information reset functionality, and the adversary obtained privileges in the compromised system to use these tools;
the adversary possesses special software implementing authentication information reset function, and obtained privileges in the compromised system to use these tools
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of amplified impact on user computing resources using third-party servers
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of installing vulnerable BIOS software update versions
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of introducing vulnerabilities into BIOS/UEFI software during its update, which can be used later to bring the computer into a "denial of service" state, unauthorized modification of BIOS/UEFI configuration, or malicious code execution at each computer startup.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in control measures for absence of vulnerabilities in newly released BIOS/UEFI software update versions.
Realization of this threat is possible during computer repair and maintenance
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of computing resource loss
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of storage medium loss
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of disclosing information stored on a lost medium (in case of absence of data encryption) or its loss (in case of absence of data backup).
This threat is caused by weaknesses in storage medium registration and accounting measures, as well as protected data backup measures.
Realization of this threat is possible due to employee negligence
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of physical destruction of storage, processing and/or I/O/transmission means
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of intentional destruction by an external adversary of storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means, which may lead to violation of availability and, in some cases, integrity of protected information.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in physical access control measures to storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains physical access to storage media (external, removable, and internal drives), information processing means (processor, device controllers, etc.), and information input/output means (keyboard, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of storage medium formatting
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of forced web browsing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining access to protected information, performing privileged operations, or conducting other destructive impacts on incorrectly protected web application components.
This threat is caused by weaknesses (or absence) of input data correctness verification mechanism on web servers.
Realization of this threat is possible if "manual entry" of specific web page addresses in the web browser address bar and forced navigation through the website tree to pages whose links are not explicitly indicated on the website is successfully implemented
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of theft of storage, processing and/or I/O/transmission means
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an external adversary stealing a computer (and devices connected to it), USB drives, optical disks, or other storage, processing, input/output/transmission means.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in physical access control measures to storage, processing, and/or input/output/transmission means.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has physical access to storage media (external, removable, and internal drives), information processing means (processor, device controllers, etc.), and information input/output means (keyboard, etc.)
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of excessive supercomputer computing resource use during intensive inter-processor messaging
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of a "denial of service" situation occurring on the part of the supercomputer's compute field.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in control measures for supercomputer computing resource distribution when processing a task by multiple processors.
Realization of this threat is possible if the supercomputer executes specific computational tasks during which inter-processor messages are generated with high intensity
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of code signing exploitation
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of exception/signal interception from privileged function block
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of denial of service propagation in cloud infrastructure
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of spreading negative consequences from threat realization at the physical or virtual level of cloud infrastructure to management and orchestration levels, as well as to all information systems deployed on the basis of the compromised cloud infrastructure.
This threat is caused by the impossibility of information system functioning in the cloud with incorrect operation of the cloud infrastructure itself, as well as dependence of upper-level cloud infrastructure operability on lower-level operability.
Realization of this threat is possible if the cloud infrastructure at the physical or virtual level is brought into a "denial of service" state
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of including insufficiently tested components in project
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating protected information security due to selection for system application of components not in accordance with their functional characteristics specified by the designer, reliability, certificate availability, etc.
This threat is caused by insufficient measures to control errors during design of security-related systems.
Realization of this threat is possible if components are selected for system application based on price, advertising, etc.
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of system redundancy introduction
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of reducing data processing speed (i.e., availability) by software components (or the system as a whole) due to introduction into it of redundant components (initially unnecessary or whose necessity disappeared when project changes were made).
This threat is caused by insufficient measures to control errors during design of security-related systems.
Realization of this threat is possible if changes are made to the list of tasks solved by the designed software (designed system)
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of computer infection when visiting malicious websites
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating protected information security by malicious programs covertly installed when system users visit (intentionally or upon accidental redirection) websites with malicious content from workstations and launched with compromised user privileges.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network traffic filtering mechanisms and antivirus control at the organizational level.
Realization of this threat is possible if system users visit websites with malicious content from workstations
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of network service access account theft
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary's unlawful familiarization with user's protected information by obtaining identification/authentication information corresponding to the user's network service (social network, cloud services, etc.) access account associated with an inactive/non-existent email address.
This threat is caused by insufficient control measures over email box activity/existence.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the email address associated with the user's network service access account has "free for occupancy" status (for example, if the user specified a non-existent address during registration or did not access the mailbox for a long time, resulting in its deactivation);
the adversary possesses information about the email address associated with the compromised user's network service access account
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of developer mechanism presence
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of hijacking program control through use of debugging mechanisms (special program functions or hardware elements helping to conduct testing and debugging of means during their development).
This threat is caused by insufficient measures to control errors during development of information protection means.
Realization of this threat is possible if debugging mechanisms are not removed from the program
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized information encryption
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of actual loss of protected data availability due to their unauthorized cryptographic transformation by an adversary using a secret key known only to them.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in antivirus protection as well as access control mechanisms.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary successfully installs cryptographic information transformation tools on the compromised computer, as well as successfully discovers (identifies) protected files
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of covert inclusion of computing device in botnet
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting indirect destructive impact on information systems from multiple computing devices (computers, mobile technical means, etc.) connected to the Internet by seizing control of such devices through unauthorized installation on them of:
Backdoor-type malware to provide the adversary with remote access/control capability over the compromised computing device;
client software for botnet inclusion and use of the botnet created in this way for various unlawful purposes (spam distribution, denial of service attacks, etc.).
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in network software and weaknesses in antivirus control and firewall mechanisms.
Realization of this threat is possible if the compromised computing device has Internet access
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of email worm propagation
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating user's protected information security by malicious programs covertly installed when system users receive emails containing email worm-type malicious programs, as well as unwitting participation in further unlawful malicious code distribution.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in antivirus control mechanisms.
Realization of this threat is possible if the compromised user has an email box and at least one other user's address in their address book
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of web server spam
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary unlawfully conducting mass distribution of commercial, political, fraudulent, and other messages to a web server without request from the compromised web servers.
This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in message filtering mechanisms incoming from the Internet.
Realization of this threat is possible if the compromised web server has activated functionality implementing various mail servers, instant messaging delivery services, blogs, forums, web store auctions, online SMS message sending services, online voting services, etc.
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of pharming
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary unlawfully familiarizing themselves with protected information (including identification/authentication) of a user by covertly redirecting the user to a fake site (looking identical to the original) where the compromised user is required to enter protected information.
This threat is caused by DNS server and router vulnerabilities.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses:
information about specific sites visited by the user requiring protected information entry;
means to create and launch a fake site;
special exploit-type software implementing user redirection to the fake site.
Additionally, this threat type affects genuine sites that do not require establishing a secure connection before entering restricted access information
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of phishing
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary unlawfully familiarizing themselves with protected information (including identification/authentication) of a user by convincing them using social engineering methods (including sending targeted emails (so-called spear-phishing attack), calls asking to open email attachments, fake advertising offers (fake offers), or various applications (fake apps)) to visit a fake site (looking identical to the original) where the compromised user is required to enter protected information or open an infected email attachment.
This threat is caused by insufficient user knowledge about phishing methods and tools.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary possesses:
information about specific sites visited by the user requiring protected information entry;
means to create and launch a fake site;
information about user contacts with a trusted organization (phone number, email address, etc.).
To convince the user to disclose restricted access information (or open an email attachment), fake emails from the administration of an organization the user interacts with (for example, a bank) are most commonly used
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of technological/production process disruption due to time delays introduced by protection tools
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of bringing the system into a "denial of service" state or disrupting normal operating mode due to time delays in real-time systems introduced into protected information transmission and processing processes by information protection means, caused by the need to process transmitted/processed information to detect and neutralize information security threats.
Realization of this threat is influenced not only by the nomenclature of applied information protection means, their configuration parameters, volume of transmitted/processed information, but also current external adversary activity, whose software impacts are processed by information protection means
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unconfirmed operator data input into security-related system
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of system operation errors due to absence (or ignoring) of error detection and correction procedures in data entered during operation by the operator themselves before activating controlled equipment. Additionally, realization of this threat may be caused by incorrectly implemented (or absent) means of responding to incorrect, spontaneous operator actions, means of accounting for lower/upper limits of operator reaction speed and direction, response schemes for double key presses when entering normal and critical data, procedures for forming time pauses with the ability to choose different responses (yes/no, etc.).
Realizability of this threat depends on requirements for error detection and correction procedures in data entered into the security-related system, as well as the difference between these requirements and actual level of error detection and correction
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized use of system and network utilities
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting destructive software impact on the system through use of existing or previously introduced standard (known and usually not detected by antivirus programs as malicious) system and network utilities intended for administrator use for system (network) diagnostics and maintenance.
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
presence in the system of standard system and network utilities or their successful introduction by the adversary into the system and concealment (using existing archives, "hidden" or "read-only" attributes, etc.);
the adversary possesses privileges to run such utilities
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized modification of protected information
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of violating protected information integrity by an adversary conducting destructive physical impact on the machine information medium or destructive software impact (including changing individual bits or complete erasure of information) on data stored on it.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains system rights to write data or physical access to the machine information medium at a distance sufficient to exert effective destructive impact
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of temperature control subsystem failure
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of damage to part of system components or the entire system due to their operating temperature regime deviating from specified requirements due to failure of ventilation subsystems and temperature devices included in it.
Realization of this threat is possible both due to natural technological causes and through conduct of certain adversary activities aimed at remote disconnection/disabling of temperature control subsystem components
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with low capability
object: Management systems and other control software
Air conditioning technical means (including piping systems for circulating cooled air in data centers)

threats.name: Threat of real-time one-time password interception
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining control over user critical operations by intercepting one-time passwords sent automatically by the system and using them to perform unlawful actions before their expiration period (usually no more than 5 minutes).
Realization of this threat is possible under the following conditions:
the adversary possesses information about the compromised user's identification/authentication information of conditionally permanent validity;
the adversary successfully intercepts traffic between the system and the user
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of hardware component physical obsolescence
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of security-related system functionality disruption due to hardware component failures in this system due to their physical obsolescence (rusting, rapid wear, oxidation, contamination, delamination, peeling, etc.) caused by physical environmental influence (humidity, dust, corrosive substances).
The possibility of realizing this threat increases when users use technical means under conditions not meeting manufacturer-specified requirements
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of industrial control system hijacking
violator: External threat actor with high capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of data aggregation processed using mobile device
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized modification of information protection tool configuration parameters
threats.description: The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting unauthorized modification of information protection tool configuration parameters. This threat is caused by weaknesses in access control measures for information protection tool configuration files. Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains access rights to the information protection tool management program interface, as well as if the adversary possesses information about the structure and format of information protection tool configuration files
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of malicious code injection through advertising, services and content
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary injecting malicious code into the information system through advertising, services and/or content (i.e., convincing the system user to activate a link, code, etc.) when the system user visits Internet sites or installs programs with advertising display functionality.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in network traffic filtering mechanisms and antivirus control at the organizational level.
Realization of this threat is possible if system users visit Internet sites from workstations
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized impact on information protection tool
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to the information protection tool management software environment and changing its operating mode.
The threat is caused by information protection tools having a management software environment and interaction with system users.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains access rights to the information protection tool management program interface
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of software substitution
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary introducing malicious software into the system by downloading and installing malicious software disguised as legitimate freely distributed software.
This threat is caused by the user having rights to install software from the Internet.
Realization of this threat is possible when downloading software from the Internet
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of malicious code action masking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of concealing malicious code actions in the system through application of special code masking mechanisms (archiving, data format changing, etc.) that prevent its further analysis.
This threat is caused by the presence of code masking methods not accounted for by signature databases of information protection means, as well as operating system mechanisms allowing search for information protection tool modules.
Realization of this threat is possible if outdated versions of information protection tools are used in the system
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of malicious code injection through visiting infected Internet sites
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of malicious code injection into software distribution package
threats.description: The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary infecting the system by installing a distribution package in which malicious code has been injected. This threat is caused by weaknesses in antivirus protection measures. Realization of this threat is possible with: user application of third-party distribution packages; absence of antivirus check before distribution package installation
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of using vulnerable software versions
threats.description: The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary conducting destructive impact on the system by exploiting software vulnerabilities. This threat is caused by weaknesses in software vulnerability analysis mechanisms. Realization of this threat is possible if there is no check before software application for presence of vulnerabilities in it
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of information leakage through malware traffic encryption algorithms
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of information leakage through malware application of traffic encryption algorithms concealing the very fact of data transmission.
This threat is caused by weaknesses in information protection measures during storage, processing, and transmission of information resources.
Realization of this threat is possible:
if the specified malware is successfully introduced into the compromised system;
in absence or insufficient implementation of firewall measures
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized use of mobile device privileged functions
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary removing manufacturer-preset restrictions on configuring mobile device privileged functions. This threat is caused by vulnerabilities in mobile device operating systems allowing access to privileged function settings.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtains access to the mobile device
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of remote malicious code execution bypassing OS protection mechanisms
violator: External threat actor with high capability
object: Stationary and mobile devices (computers and laptops) (hardware device)

threats.name: Threat of malware controlling list of applications running on mobile device
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of using a malicious program to control the list of applications running on a mobile device.
This threat is caused by insufficient antivirus protection measures allowing uncontrolled malware launch (absence of permitted software control). Realization of this threat is possible if malware is introduced on the mobile device and unintentionally launched by the user themselves
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of authentication information theft from temporary cookie files
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of theft using malware of user authentication information, their accounts stored in temporary cookie files, and transmission of this information to adversaries through an open RDP port.
This threat is caused by insufficient antivirus protection measures allowing uncontrolled malware launch (absence of permitted software control).
Additionally, this threat is caused by failure to take measures to erase residual information from temporary files (clearing temporary files).
Realization of this threat is possible if the attacked computer has an open RDP port
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
object: Information (stored on computer in temporary files (software))

threats.name: Threat of covert registration of administrator accounts by malware
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of covert creation by introduced malware of accounts with administrator rights for subsequent use for unauthorized access to user information and software settings installed on the infected computer.
This threat is caused by insufficient antivirus protection measures allowing uncontrolled malware launch (absence of permitted software control).
Additionally, this threat is caused by insufficient access control measures (control of user account creation).
Realization of this threat is possible if the attacked computer has an open RDP port
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
object: Access control system (built into computer operating system (software))

threats.name: Threat of mobile device control hijacking when using virtual voice assistants
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of controlling a mobile device and applications running on it on behalf of a legitimate user by transmitting these commands through virtual voice assistants (for example, through Siri for iPhone).
This threat is caused by user authentication problems, particularly by Voice ID. The voice assistant cannot be completely confident that the voice addressing it belongs to the device owner, so for user convenience and operation guarantee, low Voice ID sensitivity is set. This allows the adversary to use device owner's speech recorded on a voice recorder. Realization of this threat is possible if the virtual voice assistant is in active state (i.e., not disabled) and low voice identifier sensitivity is set
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of information theft from mobile device when using virtual voice assistants
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of stealing user data from their mobile device through virtual voice assistants (for example, through Siri for iPhone).
This threat is caused by user authentication problems, particularly by Voice ID. The voice assistant cannot be completely confident that the voice addressing it belongs to the device owner, so for user convenience and operation guarantee, low Voice ID sensitivity is set. This allows the adversary to use device owner's speech recorded on a voice recorder. Realization of this threat is possible if the virtual voice assistant is in active state (i.e., not disabled) and low voice identifier sensitivity is set
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of user data leakage when using browser authentication autofill functions
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of user data leakage through use of the authorization form autofill function implemented in browsers.
Realization of this threat is caused by storage in browsers in open form of user data used for authorization form autofill.
Realization of this threat is possible if the user uses a browser in which the authorization form autofill function is implemented and activated
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized application installation on mobile devices
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of installing applications on virtual machines of mobile devices running Android operating system, launched without authorization by introduced malware. The malware launches a virtual machine on the mobile device, places (installs) an unlimited number of applications in this virtual machine.
This threat is caused by insufficient measures to control application software launch, allowing uncontrolled malicious application software launch upon user performing various actions in the system (for example, when user attempts to close unwanted advertising).
Realization of this threat is possible if there is malware on the mobile device capable of launching a virtual machine and installing an application in this virtual machine
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of information leakage from computers not connected to Internet
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of stealing data from computers not connected to the Internet by compromising their hardware elements or switching equipment devices (for example, routers) equipped with LED indicators, capturing flickering of these indicators, and deciphering obtained results.
Realization of this threat is caused by the fact that there exists the possibility of unauthorized control acquisition of these indicators (through special firmware or privilege escalation and malicious code execution), allowing information transmission by converting it into a sequence of computer and switching equipment indicator signals.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary obtained physical access to the compromised computer or switching equipment to install means for visual capture of LED indicator signals
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized modification by malware of PLC parameter values
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of unauthorized modification by malware of control and management parameter values for actuating devices in programmable logic controllers after its penetration and authorization on these devices.
Threat realization is caused by the malware's ability to detect programmable logic controllers on the network, penetrate and function in the programmable logic controller operating system, as well as authentication mechanism deficiencies.
Realization of this threat is possible if there exists the possibility of accessing industrial control system elements over the Internet
violator: External threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of computer malfunction and data access blocking due to incorrect operation of protection tools installed on it
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of computer malfunction and denial of access to its data due to erroneous file blocking by information protection tool.
Realization of this threat is caused by the fact that an information protection tool implementing file blocking function is installed on the computer
violator: External threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of equipment operation denial due to geolocation information change
threats.description: The threat consists of CNC equipment operation cessation caused by geolocation information change about this equipment. The threat is caused by CNC equipment geolocation binding to a specific geographic coordinate during commissioning work. The threat is realized when CNC equipment is relocated and leads to impossibility of its further operation
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to equipment configuration parameters using master codes (engineering passwords)
threats.description: The threat consists of unauthorized access to information configuration parameters in CNC equipment through use of special "master codes" (engineering passwords) "hard-coded" (not changeable through configuration) in this equipment's software. The threat is caused by the need for repair work during CNC equipment software failures by manufacturer representatives
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of non-targeted use of computing device computing resources
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of using computing device computing resources to conduct third-party computational processes.
The threat is realized by introducing malware into computing devices containing code implementing use of computing resources for its own needs (in particular, for cryptocurrency mining).
This threat is caused by insufficiency of the following information protection measures:
antivirus protection measures, allowing malware installation and launch;
software environment restriction measures, allowing the adversary to conduct uncontrolled launch of software components.
violator: External threat actor with medium capability
External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with medium capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of unauthorized access to protected processor kernel memory
violator: External threat actor with low capability
Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of information system malfunction caused by software update
threats.description:
The threat consists of possible disruption of software, hardware-software information system elements or the information system as a whole due to incorrect operation of installed system software updates (patches).
The threat is caused by presence of critical errors, defects, vulnerabilities in information system software used.
Realization of this threat is possible when updates are installed on information system hardware-software components
violator: Internal threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of using unverified user data when forming configuration file used by information system administration software
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of destructive impact on the information system and information processed by it as a result of software operation used for information system administration.
This threat is related to weaknesses in the user data verification procedure used when forming configuration file for information system administration software.
Realization of this threat is possible if the information system uses information system administration software that uses configuration files formed based on user data as source data
violator: Internal threat actor with low capability

threats.name: Threat of information system control hijacking
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of an adversary gaining unauthorized access to information system information, software, and computing resources as a result of substitution of information system or its component centralized management tools.
This threat is caused by the presence in centralized management tools of program interfaces for interaction with other access subjects (processes, programs) and, as a consequence, the possibility of unauthorized access to these centralized management tools, as well as insufficient access control measures for them.
Realization of this threat is possible if the adversary has rights to interact with centralized management tools
violator: Internal threat actor with medium capability

threats.name: Threat of multi-factor authentication bypass
threats.description:
The threat consists of the possibility of bypassing multi-factor authentication by introducing malicious code into the compromised system and components participating in the multi-factor authentication procedure.
This threat is caused by:
presence of software vulnerabilities;
weaknesses in antivirus protection and access control measures.
Realization of this threat is possible:
if the compromised user works with files coming from untrusted sources;
if they have software installation privileges
violator: External threat actor with high capability

threats.name: Threat of untimely detection and response by information system components to security events
threats.description:
The threat consists of missing and/or significant time delay in determining (detecting) information security events, leading to absence of response to unauthorized information system access attempts, to malware introduction.
This threat is caused by incorrect configuration of information (automated) system components and/or information protection tools, as well as absence of such components and/or information protection tools.
